dublin_core.dcvalue: Digital health solutions are often presented as a panacea a one stop solution that fill gaps and overcomes complex health sector barriers in low and middle income countries LMICs In practice digital infrastructure and connectivity lag uptake of new technology and data use are tough nuts to crack and coordination of well meaning partners is exceedingly difficult Though technical solutions seem to abound bringing them to scale has proven elusive In this session we will take the country perspective focusing on 5 key areas that cut across digital health programs policy tech and tools partner coordination data quality and streamlining and data use Experts from Malawi a pioneering country for digital health leadership will honestly discuss their efforts and challenges in these key domains Presented by Hannah Cooper Co Founder and Managing Director Cooper Smith
A 360Â° Country Perspective on Digital Health Development: The Case of Malawi
